Posted By: syrazemyla (12/11/2011 8:18:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@uncountednose  
  
The creature that returns to play is a new object and won't be subject to the sacrifice trigger. Any time an object leaves the battlefield and returns it has no connection to its prior existence. This is why cards like [Momentary Blink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentary Blink) work, read the rulings on that card. This also works with [Teferi's Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi's Veil).
posts.html:
@uncountednose

The creature that returns to play is a new object and won't be subject to the sacrifice trigger. Any time an object leaves the battlefield and returns it has no connection to its prior existence. This is why cards like Momentary Blink work, read the rulings on that card. This also works with Teferi's Veil.

posts.post_content: I have a Killer Instinct deck. I find that a [Crystal Ball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystal Ball) and [Wheel of Sun and Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel of Sun and Moon) really make it sing. Throw in some [Ondu Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ondu Giant)-type cards to clear the lands out of the deck and you can actually do some real damage. It's great for casual.
posts.html:
I have a Killer Instinct deck. I find that a Crystal Ball and Wheel of Sun and Moon really make it sing. Throw in some Ondu Giant-type cards to clear the lands out of the deck and you can actually do some real damage. It's great for casual.
